feats.name: Ability Improvement
feats.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

feats.name: Actor
feats.description: Your Charisma ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. You gain expertise in Deception and Performance.
notes: If not already proficient, the character also gains proficiency in the chosen skills.

feats.name: Alert
feats.description: You gain a +5 bonus to initiative and can't be Surprised.

feats.name: Athlete
feats.description: Your Strength or Dexterity ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump distance also increases by 50%.

feats.name: Charger

options.name: Charger: Weapon Attack
options.description: Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

options.name: Charger: Shove
options.description: Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way. Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.

notes: Charger: Weapon attack uses Action + Bonus action, moves up to 9 m / 30 ft, and makes a melee attack with +5 damage.
This counts as a single weapon attack, and benefits from Extra Attack.

options.name: Crossbow Expert: Point-Blank
options.description: When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the attack rolls do not have disadvantage.

options.name: Crossbow Expert: Wounding
options.description: Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

feats.name: Defensive Duellist
feats.description: When you are attacked with a melee attack while wielding a Finesse weapon you are proficient in, you can use a Reaction to increase your Armour Class by your proficiency bonus, possibly causing the attack to miss.
feats.prerequisite: Requires Dexterity to be higher than 13.

feats.name: Dual Wielder

options.name: Dual Wielder
options.description: You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if your weapons aren't Light. You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

options.name: Dual Wielder: Bonus Armour Class
options.description: You have a +1 bonus to Armour Class while wielding a melee weapon in each hand.

notes: This feat doesn't give the Two-Weapon Fighting style, it just allows a creature to dual wield non-light non-heavy weapons.
Simple melee weapons: Javelins, Maces, Quarterstaves, and Spears.
Martial melee weapons: Battleaxes, Flails, Longswords, Morningstars, Rapiers, Tridents, War Picks, and Warhammers.

options.name: Dungeon Delver: Perception
options.description: You gain advantage on Perception checks made to detect hidden objects and on Saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.

options.name: Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps
options.description: You gain resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

feats.name: Durable
feats.description: Your Constitution ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Regain full hit points every time you take a short rest.
notes: For Wild Shape, this adds +1 Constitution and full HP on a short rest, but does not increase Wild Shape form HP.

feats.name: Elemental Adept
feats.description: Spells you cast ignore resistance to a damage type of your choice. When you deal that type of damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
options.description: Spells you cast and attacks you make ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Elemental Adept: Cold
options.description: Spells you cast and attacks you make ignore Resistance to Cold damage. In addition, when you deal Cold damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning
options.description: Spells you cast and attacks you make ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. In addition, when you deal Lightning damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Elemental Adept: Fire
options.description: Spells you cast and attacks you make ignore Resistance to Fire damage. In addition, when you deal Fire damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder
options.description: Spells you cast and attacks you make ignore Resistance to Thunder damage. In addition, when you deal Thunder damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

notes: "You cannot roll a 1" means that any 1 rolled is treated as a 2.

feats.name: Great Weapon Master

options.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
options.description: When an attack with a melee weapon lands a Critical Hit or kills a creature, you can make another melee weapon attack as a Bonus action that turn.

options.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
options.description: When attacking with a Two-Handed or Versatile melee weapon in both hands that you are Proficient with, Attack rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

notes: All In is a toggleable passive ability.

feats.name: Heavily Armoured
feats.description: Your Strength ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Gain Proficiency with Heavy armour.

feats.name: Heavy Armour Master
feats.description: Your Strength ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

feats.name: Lightly Armoured
feats.description: Your Strength or Dexterity ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Gain Proficiency with Light armour.

feats.name: Lucky
feats.description: You gain 3 Luck Points that recharge after a Long Rest, which you can use to gain advantage on Attack rolls, Ability checks, or Saving throws, or to make an enemy reroll their Attack roll.

options.name: Mage Slayer: Saving Throw Advantage
options.description: When a creature casts a Spell within melee range of you, you have advantage on any Saving throws against it.

options.name: Mage Slayer: Attack Caster
options.description: You can use a Reaction to immediately make an attack against the caster if it casts a spell within 1.5m / 5ft of you.

options.name: Mage Slayer: Break Concentration
options.description: Enemies you hit have disadvantage on Concentration Saving throws.

feats.name: Magic Initiate: Bard
feats.description: Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Bard spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

feats.name: Magic Initiate: Cleric
feats.description: Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Cleric spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Wisdom.
notes: While wearing medium armor, the bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2. [Needs Verification]
The AC bonus increase is not listed in-game, and can also be gained by taking the Medium Armour Master feat. [Needs Verification]

feats.name: Magic Initiate: Druid
feats.description: Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Druid spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Wisdom.

feats.name: Magic Initiate: Sorcerer
feats.description: Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Sorcerer spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

feats.name: Magic Initiate: Warlock
feats.description: Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Warlock spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

feats.name: Magic Initiate: Wizard
feats.description: Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Wizard spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Intelligence.

feats.name: Martial Adept
feats.description: Learn two Manoeuvres from the Battle Master archetype and receive 1 (additional) Superiority Die to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a Short or Long Rest.

feats.name: Medium Armour Master
feats.description: When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

options.name: Mobile
options.description: Your Movement Speed increases by 3 m / 10 ft.

options.name: Mobile: Evade Difficult Terrain
options.description: When you use the Dash action, Difficult Terrain doesn't slow you down.

options.name: Mobile: Evade Opportunity Attack
options.description: If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke an Opportunity Attack from that target.

feats.name: Moderately Armoured
feats.description: Your Strength or Dexterity ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Gain Proficiency with Medium armour and Shields.

feats.name: Performer
feats.description: Your Charisma ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Gain Musical Instrument Proficiency.

feats.name: Polearm Master

options.name: Polearm Master: Bonus Attack
options.description: When attacking with a Glaive, Halberd, Pike, Quarterstaff, or Spear, you can use a Bonus action to attack with the butt of your weapon.

options.name: Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack
options.description: You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

notes: The Polearm Master: Bonus Attack deals 1d4 + Strength Modifier bludgeoning damage if Strength is used for the attack roll. However, if another ability is used for the attack roll (such as through Shillelagh or Pact of the Blade) then Dexterity will be used for the damage roll.
The Polearm Master: Bonus Attack often does not apply additional damage-on-hit effects, such as Hunter's Mark or the additional damage from Great Weapon Master.
Polearm Master works with Pikes even though this is not stated in-game.

feats.name: Resilient
feats.description: You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20. Gain Proficiency in that ability's Saving Throws.

options.name: Resilient: Strength
options.description:
You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain Proficiency in that ability's Saving Throws.

options.name: Resilient: Dexterity
options.description:
You increase your Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain Proficiency in Dexterity Saving Throws.

options.name: Resilient: Constitution
options.description:
You increase your Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain Proficiency in Constitution Saving Throws.

options.name: Resilient: Intelligence
options.description:
You increase your Intelligence by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain Proficiency in Intelligence Saving Throws.

options.name: Resilient: Wisdom
options.description:
You increase your Wisdom by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain Proficiency in Wisdom Saving Throws.

options.name: Resilient: Charisma
options.description:
You increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain Proficiency in Charisma Saving Throws.

notes: This Ability increase applies to druids in Wild Shape.

feats.name: Ritual Caster
feats.description: You learn two Ritual spells of your choice.
notes: The available spells are:
Enhance Leap
Disguise Self
Find Familiar
Longstrider
Speak with Animals
Speak with Dead

feats.name: Savage Attacker
feats.description: When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

options.name: Sentinel: Vengeance
options.description: When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

options.name: Sentinel: Snare
options.description: When you hit a creature with an Attack of Opportunity, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

options.name: Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage
options.description: You gain advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

feats.name: Sharpshooter

options.name: Sharpshooter: Low Ground
options.description: Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

options.name: Sharpshooter: All In
options.description: Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.

notes: All In is a toggleable passive ability.

feats.name: Shield Master
feats.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throw when wielding a Shield.

options.name: Shield Master: Block
options.description: If a Spell forces you to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.

notes: On a failed save, you only take half damage.
On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.
BUG: As of Hotfix 25, this feat does not reduce the damage taken on a failed save.
Unlike the DnD counterpart, this feat doesn't take shield AC into account and instead only offers a flat bonus to Dexterity saving throw.

feats.name: Skilled
feats.description: You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

feats.name: Spell Sniper
feats.description: You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking with a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
notes: The available cantrips are:
Bone Chill
Eldritch Blast
Fire Bolt
Ray of Frost
Shocking Grasp
Thorn Whip
These cantrips use the character's Spellcasting Ability. For example, if a Cleric chooses Eldritch Blast with this feat, they use their Wisdom modifier and not their Charisma modifier.
All available cantrips are Spell Attacks and use Attack roll.

feats.name: Tavern Brawler
feats.description: Your Strength or Constitution ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your strength modifier is added twice to the damage and Attack roll.
notes: Unarmed attacks that use Dexterity as a modifier still gain the strength modifier as a bonus with this feat and thus don't get the Dexterity modifier applied twice to the attack.

feats.name: Tough
feats.description: Hit Point maximum increased by 2 for each level.

feats.name: War Caster
feats.description: You gain advantage on Saving throws to maintain Concentration on a Spell. You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.
notes: This feat does not grant the ability to use Shocking Grasp at will. Unless you know it from another source, you can only use it as an Attack of Opportunity.
Casting Shocking Grasp as an Attack of Opportunity uses the character's Spellcasting Ability. For example, if a Cleric casts Shocking Grasp with this feat, they use their Wisdom modifier.

feats.name: Weapon Master
feats.description: Your Strength or Dexterity ability score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.
